creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: lacquer dish or stand with raised foliate rim and slightly sunken well, standing on a high circular foot; covered with red lacquer at interior, black elsewhere
medium: Red and black lacquer with carved decor
text: Fashioned with an elegant raised foliate rim, this dish or stand is set on a high circular foot. The well is carved in the center with the lung character meaning dragon. Sung lacquers are characterized by smooth surface well-proportioned functional shapes and restrained decoration. Although most excavated Sung lacquer comes from the South, the shape of this example with its foliate rim has much in common with porcelain of the North especially ting ware.
title: Dish
